identificationModule.briefTitle: Naxitamab for High-Risk Neuroblastoma Patients With Primary Refractory Disease or Incomplete Response to Salvage Treatment in Bone and/or Bone Marrow
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Pivotal Phase 2 Trial of Antibody Naxitamab (hu3F8) and Granulocyte-Macrophage Colony Stimulating Factor (GM-CSF) in High-Risk Neuroblastoma Patients With Primary Refractory Disease or Incomplete Response to Salvage Treatment in Bone and/or Bone Marrow

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Children and adults diagnosed with high-risk neuroblastoma patients with primary refractory disease or incomplete response to salvage treatment in bone and/or bone marrow will be treated for up to 101 weeks with naxitamab and granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor (GM-CSF). Patients will be followed for up to five years after first dose.

Naxitamab, also known as hu3F8 is a humanised monoclonal antibody targeting GD2
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Each patient will receive treatment for up to 101 weeks following the first Naxitamab administration. After the end of trial visit, each patient will enter a long-term follow-up where they will be monitored for up to 5 years after first treatment cycle.

Each investigational cycle is started with 5 days, days -4 to 0, of Granulocyte-Macrophage Colony Stimulating Factor (GM-CSF) administered at 250 µg/m2/day in advance of the start of Naxitamab administration. GM-CSF is thereafter administered at 500 µg/m2/day on days 1 to 5. As standard treatment, Naxitamab is administered at 3 mg/kg/day on days 1, 3, and 5, totalling 9 mg/kg per cycle.

Treatment cycles are repeated every 4 weeks (±1 week) until complete response or partial response followed by 5 additional cycles every 4 weeks (±1 week). Subsequent cycles are repeated every 8 weeks (±2 weeks) through 101 weeks from first infusion at the discretion of the investigator. End of treatment will take place around 8 weeks after the last cycle and thereafter long-term follow-up will continue.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Patients will receive cycles of GM-CSF and Naxitamab every 4 weeks up to a total of 101 weeks. Safety and efficacy will be investigated with short-term follow-up at minimum 4 weeks after last treatment and with long-term follow-up for up to 3 years after end of treatment visit.

armGroups.label: GM-CSF + Naxitamab
armGroups.description: Each investigational cycle is started with 5 days of GM-CSF administered at 250 µg/m2/day in advance of the start of Naxitamab administration. GM-CSF is thereafter administered at 500 µg/m2/day on days 1 to 5. As standard treatment, Naxitamab is administered at 3 mg/kg/day on days 1, 3, and 5 totalling 9 mg/kg per cycle. Treatment cycles are repeated every 4 weeks until CR or PR followed by 5 additional cycles every 4 weeks (±1 week). Subsequent cycles are repeated every 8 weeks (±2 weeks) through 101 weeks from first infusion at the discretion of the investigator. After end of treatment patients will enter a long-term follow up for up to 3 years after end of treatment visit.

interventions.name: GM-CSF + Naxitamab
interventions.description: Granulocyte-Macrophage Colony Stimulating Factor (GM-CSF) and Humanized IgG1 monoclonal GD2 antibody

primaryOutcomes.description: Overall objective response rate (ORR) during the Naxitamab treatment period that will be centrally assessed according to the International Neuroblastoma Response Criteria (INRC) modified with 123I-MIBG criteria and following the use of 18F FDG-PET for MIBG non-avid lesions.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of adverse events and serious adverse events
secondaryOutcomes.description: Safety will be evaluated by the incidence of adverse events (AE) and serious adverse events (SAEs) graded according to CTCAE, version 4.0.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Duration of Response (DoR)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Length of time from patient response to disease progression.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Complete Response Rate
secondaryOutcomes.description: The complete response (CR) rate is defined as the fraction of patients experiencing a CR according to International Neuroblastoma Response Criteria (INRC) criteria during the treatment period.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Assessment of the maximum serum concentration (cmax) of naxitamab
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculation of maximum serum concentration of naxitamab will be calculated and summarized with descriptive statistics.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Assessment of the minimum serum concentration (cmin) of naxitamab
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculation of minimum serum concentration of naxitamab will be calculated and summarized with descriptive statistics.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Assessment of the clearance of naxitamab
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculation of clearance of naxitamab will be calculated and summarized with descriptive statistics.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Assessment of the volume of distribution of naxitamab
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculation of the volume of distribution of naxitamab will be calculated and summarized with descriptive statistics.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Assessment of the Area under the Curve (AUC) of naxitamab
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculation of the AUC of naxitamab will be calculated and summarized with descriptive statistics.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Assessment of the terminal half-life (t½) of naxitamab
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculation of the t½ of naxitamab will be calculated and summarized with descriptive statistics.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Assessment of anti-drug antibody (ADA) formation
secondaryOutcomes.description: ADA formation will be investigated following a multi-tiered approach: A screening confirmation-titration analysis plus a ligand binding assay to examine a potential neutralizing effect of anti-naxitamab antibodies.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Intravenous (IV) opioid use (cycle 1)
secondaryOutcomes.description: IV opioid use during cycle 1 defined as total dosage of IV morphine (or equivalent opioid) administered 2 hours before infusion until 4 hours after end of infusion of naxitamab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Intravenous (IV) opioid use (all cycles)
secondaryOutcomes.description: IV opioid use for each cycle during the trial defined as total dosage of IV morphine (or equivalent opioid) administered 2 hours before infusion until 4 hours after end of infusion of naxitamab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Hospitalization days (cycle 1)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of hospitalization days related to naxitamab during cycle 1, defined as number of overnight stays. Hospitalizations required solely for protocol-specified assessments (e.g., PK sampling) or non-medical circumstances are excluded

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Safety of patients with positive human anti-drug antibody (ADA)
secondaryOutcomes.description: In patients with positive ADA at trial inclusion, safety will be evaluated by the incidence of AEs and SAEs graded according to CTCAE, version 4.0

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of infusions done in an outpatient setting
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of infusions done in an outpatient setting

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of infusions done in an outpatient setting
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of infusions done in an outpatient setting

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of adverse events and serious adverse events in ADA positive patients
secondaryOutcomes.description: Safety will be evaluated by the incidence of adverse events (AE) and serious adverse events (SAEs) graded according to CTCAE, version 4.0 in ADA positive patients.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: PFS, defined as the time from the first 1st infusion of naxitamab until progressive disease or death, whichever comes first

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Overall Survival
secondaryOutcomes.description: The interval from the date of first dose of Naxitamab until the date of death due to any cause.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Happiness and activity levels
secondaryOutcomes.description: Happiness and activity levels will be measured over time and assessed by caretaker

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosis of neuroblastoma as defined per International Neuroblastoma Response Criteria
* High-risk neuroblastoma patients with either primary refractory disease or incomplete response to salvage treatment (in both cases including stable disease, minor response and partial response) evaluable in bone and/or bone marrow.
* Life expectancy ≥ 6 months

Exclusion Criteria:

* Any systemic anti-cancer therapy, including chemotherapy or immunotherapy, within 3 weeks before 1st dose of GM-CSF
* Evaluable neuroblastoma outside bone and bone marrow
* Existing major organ dysfunction \> Grade 2, with the exception of hearing loss, hematological status, kidney and liver function
* Active life-threatening infection

locations.facility: Hopital pour enfants de la Timone
Fondazione IRCCS Istituto Nazionale dei Tumori
Hospital Universitario y Politécnico La Fe
